allow: Bash(else echo "output directory does not exist")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Fix iwf_meet_id mismatch causing incorrect result counts

The iwf_meet_results table was storing database auto-increment IDs (like 4, 27) 
in the iwf_meet_id column instead of the correct IWF event IDs (like 661).
This broke the relationship between iwf_meets and iwf_meet_results, causing 
result counts to show as zero.

Bug #1: The meetInfo object passed to resultsImporter was missing the 
iwf_meet_id field, causing the mappers to use an undefined value.

Bug #2: The fallback logic `iwf_meet_id: meetInfo?.iwf_meet_id || meetId` 
incorrectly used db_meet_id when iwf_meet_id was undefined.

Fixes:
- Add iwf_meet_id to meetInfo in iwf-database-importer.js:207
- Remove incorrect fallback logic in iwf-results-importer.js:131

Result: iwf_meet_results.iwf_meet_id now correctly stores IWF event IDs,
and queries can properly join meets with results.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Remove redundant denormalized columns from iwf_meet_results

The following columns are already available via foreign key relationships
and should not be stored redundantly in iwf_meet_results:

- country_code, country_name, gender, birth_year (via FK to iwf_lifters)
- iwf_meet_id (via FK to iwf_meets)

Benefits:
- Single source of truth for lifter attributes
- Improved data integrity and consistency
- Reduced storage footprint
- Changes to lifter data automatically reflected across all results

Queries now use JOINs to access these values from related tables:
- SELECT l.country_code FROM iwf_meet_results r
  JOIN iwf_lifters l ON r.db_lifter_id = l.db_lifter_id

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
